review_title: Samsung Galaxy S21 FE 5G (2023) Review: Lavender Dream with Power-Packed Performance
review_body: I recently purchased the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE 5G (2023) in the stunning Lavender color variant, equipped with a Snapdragon 888 processor, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations in many ways.Delivery Experience:Firstly, I was pleasantly surprised by the swift delivery process from Amazon. The product arrived even before the expected delivery date, ensuring a tension-free experience.Design and Color:The Lavender color portrayed on the website was precisely what I received. The device's sleek design and elegant color instantly caught my attention, adding a touch of sophistication to my tech collection.Performance:Powered by the Snapdragon 888 processor, this phone delivers lightning-fast performance. Apps open instantly, multitasking is seamless, and gaming is a joy with no lag whatsoever. The 8GB RAM ensures smooth operation even with multiple apps running simultaneously.Storage:With a spacious 256GB of internal storage, I have ample space to store all my photos, videos, and apps without worrying about running out of space.Value for Money:One of the highlights of my purchase was the significant discount I received, bringing the price down to a very reasonable 33,968.00. Coupled with additional credit card discounts, it was an offer too good to resist.Accessories:While the package did not include a charger or a back cover, it did come with a USB-C to USB-C cable. While this might be considered a disadvantage by some, it's worth noting that many users already have spare chargers and covers from previous devices. Nevertheless, it would have been a nice addition to include these accessories.Overall, the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE 5G (2023) in Lavender is a powerhouse of a smartphone that offers exceptional performance, ample storage, and a stunning design. Despite the minor drawback of missing accessories, the overall experience has been nothing short of excellent. I would highly recommend it to anyone in the market for a top-tier smartphone at a competitive price point.рдореИрдВрдиреЗ рд╣рд╛рд▓ рд╣реА рдореЗрдВ рд▓реИрд╡реЗрдВрдбрд░ рд░рдВрдЧ рдХреЗ review_title: Best camera and software mobile in mid range

The media could not be loaded.
                



I had OnePlus One(died), then Samsung S7(still working), OnePlus 7t(sudden death after 3 years)and now S21 FE.The overall quality of the phone is great apart from back plastic.The UI and overall experience of the phone is great as compared to OnePlus as it has custom Samsung tweaks everywhere (it was there in S7 as well with obviously little less features and refinement), which makes actually sense and makes you feel wow. Haptic is also great while typing ( but only X axis). But feel it's average in other use cases. One thing which personally do not like is the Samsung custom apps.The Camera is hands down the best in class. (But glare is bad, I am a photographer and that is the only reason you don't see the glare in the night shot)Only deal breaker is see is the battery optimisation. It is real, like global warming.Apart from it, this is a great phone.Let's see if can optimise it further.Note: There is a pixel less area sorrounding the front camera. Be careful if you are also  observant.

review_title: Only Thing To Consider While Buying
review_body: I am using the Galaxy S21 Fe snapdragon 888 8GB/128GB from past 1 month now it is on One Ui 6.0  (Android 14) With December 2023 security patch and the device is good at every expect accept battery optimization the SOT I get is 5 Hour's Max With continues usage of YT, WhatsApp, Clash Of Clan at 120FPS in between with some instagram so you need to CHARGE this device 2 times a day if you are more then a light user (means using phone for not only for calls and WhatsApp)And as I live in Delhi and it's a cold in January 2024 so device not heating anyways but it will feels more warm in summer as you are using camera or gaming maby sometime while instagram reels scrolling)That's it folks hope it will get you an idea weather you consider it a buy or not

review_title: One of the best from Samsung
review_body: After two weeks of use I'm completely happy with this mobile.  Very good display. Battery performance could have done better. For normal usage it I'd enough for a day long use.
Very good speed and user friendly features. Very good mobile
Good product

Don't buy, those who play games.., just Okey for regular normal usage.

Camera, processor, display, performance and Mainly Optimization of s21 fe is outstanding.....Even the Rs. 50-60 k phones are fade in front of it.

review_title: Very good Mobile with poor Battery
